timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: Yes, otherwise we don't know what was the data that it couldn't parse. It normally contains an error from TES which is useful for the customer.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: nit: it's possible that customers run a private build. What are the use cases of builtin component metadata?
timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: This is why I changed the recipe download to look for private components first. So it will check for that before falling back to public.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I meant the existing builtin components could be private, but I'm fine with this implementation until we have enough information
replies.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: Yes, exactly. If it is private then when we go to look it up in the cloud it will be found first.
replies.author: MikeDombo
